job_title: Human Resources Officer in London, England
pros:
Work life balance
Supportive manager
Training opportunities for graduate hires
Lovely people
cons: None, it's a great place to work!

job_title: Head of Finance in London, England

review_title: Great company, Great People, A few improvements needed
pros:
Gorgeous offices
Flexible working
Charity/Away days
Fresh fruit
Excellent office/working space
Training opportunities
cons:
A lot of middle management, less of the doers and people focused on delivery
Micromanagement - but without the label. Lots of managers think they are offering empowerment, but its limited and not what I have experienced.
Processes and procedures being setup are perfect for a big corporate... but not for this size. 
Unnecessary meetings - lets just have a catch up instead of having to put 3-4 hours of meetings in every day.

review_title: Great people and a sense of team
pros: Really nice company and the people are great to work with. They have lots of team building events, good pension and annual leave benefits as well as a relaxed dress code.
cons: Reluctant to let people work from home. They don't always hire good people which is a shame. The reason I left is because my new manager didn't have a clue what I did in my role and started changing it. I may have stayed otherwise

review_title: decent employer in a constantly moving environment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in City of London, England
pros:
good working conditions, BUPA,  fresh fruit,  social events
respectful of staff and their needs.. new staff training programme in progress
senior managers are all decent people
good practical on job experience in any role
cons:
small, so internal prospects limited
open plan, which i personally dont like

pros: Friendly and helpful staff with plenty of support and collaboration.
cons: Lack of overall structure and guidance.
